title: Australian prison drama Wentworth begins filming its final season
text:
Wentworth officially started filming its final season in Melbourne this week.

And on Friday, Foxtel announced that three new cast members will be starring in the upcoming episodes of the prison drama.

Foxtel's Executive Director of Television, Brian Walsh, confirmed that Kate Box, Zoe Terakes and Jane Hall will be joining the show.

Exciting! Australian prison drama Wentworth has started filming its final season in Melbourne this week

'Since its debut in 2013, Wentworth boasts a large and loyal worldwide following and continually attracts some of the country's finest actors and production creatives, we are thrilled to welcome Kate, Jane and Zoe on board,' he told TV Tonight.

Kate, who starred in drama series Les Norton, is set to play the character of Lou Kelly, who is a former top dog of Wentworth.

Neighbour's Jane Hall will take on the role of Ann Reynolds, a General Manager who is not afraid to punish the prisoners.

New cast: Foxtel has announced that Kate Box (centre), Zoe Terakes (right) and Jane Hall (left) will be starring in the upcoming episodes

Role: Zoe Terakes (pictured), who previously starred in The End, will play the trans character of 'Reb' Keane who is a rebel

And Zoe Terakes, who previously starred in The End, will play the trans character of 'Reb' Keane.

The final season will also feature a number of returning cast members including Pamela Rabe, Kate Atkinson, Leah Purcell and Susie Porter.

This comes after Foxtel confirmed that the upcoming ninth season of Wentworth will be the last.

She's back! Neighbour's Jane Hall (pictured) will take on the role of Ann Reynolds, a General Manager who is not afraid to punish the prisoners

The show won't be wrapping on screens in a hurry, with the upcoming episodes being spread over the the next two years.

Speaking to TV Week earlier this year, Brian said: 'Foxtel is proud and delighted to confirm a further 20 episodes of the renewal of this much loved drama is testament to Foxtel's unwavering commitment to Australian story-telling.'

Brian said that Australia's longest-running one hour drama series will go out with a bang, and will feature several 'interesting names' making appearances.
description: Wentworth officially started filming its final season in Melbourne this week.
authors: Mary Mrad For Daily Mail Australia
